DataElement.preferredName: Colorectal Surgical Procedure Sphincter Preservation Procedure Plan Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there was a plan, prior to a surgical procedure involving the colon, rectum and anal canal, to preserve the functional viability of the ring-shaped muscle that relaxes or tightens to open or close the anal passage.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Colorectal Surgical Procedure Sphincter Preservation Procedure Plan
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to plan, prior to a surgical procedure involving the colon, rectum and anal canal, to preserve the functional viability of the ring-shaped muscle that relaxes or tightens to open or close the anal passage.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (ko-lo-REK-tul) Having to do with the colon or the rectum.:Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the colon and rectum, or to the entire large bowel.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: A ring-shaped muscle that relaxes or tightens to open or close a passage or opening in the body. Examples are the anal sphincter (around the opening of the anus) and the pyloric sphincter (at the lower opening of the stomach).:Techniques and methods utilized to save organic substances from decay. Some preservation technique are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state.:Planned; devised, contrived, or formed in design.

Concepts.definition: A circular band of muscle that functions to regulate the size of an orifice in the body.
Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state.
To devise, contrive, or form in design.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
